profile_positions.description:
As a Dutch organization, NewBees is committed to an inclusive integration for municipalities, by guiding newcomers to local entrepreneurs and organizations, and by advising and guiding companies in the field of Diversity and Inclusion.

NewBees makes room for talent. For newcomers who integrate and want to gain work experience, for municipalities that welcome them and for employers who strive for inclusion, in any field.

During my time on board, I worked for 224 hours as a volunteer, helping refugees to find internships and work opportunities and advising them accordingly. The following were among my tasks:

• Conducting online and in-person interviews with Refugees to identify their needs.
• Providing advice and support in searching for a job/internship and case management.
profile_positions.title: Matcher at NewBees/ Netherlands/ Volunteer

profile_positions.description:
I was in charge of administration and finances. During my term, I was awarded for advocacy of refugee rights in the Nakival refugee settlement back in December 2019 by Ngoma Festival Refugee Award. 

Before being appointed as the first Vice-president, I contributed to the redaction, and amendment of the Memorandum of the Constitution, several Memoranda of Understanding (MoU), and the organization profile. 

I established a professional workforce in the workplace, which enable the organization to attract external partners to work with it.
profile_positions.title: 1st VICE-PRESIDENT - ADMINISTRATION AND FINANCES/VOLUNTEER WORK

profile_positions.description:
• Providing group information sessions to refugees (Congolese, South Sudanese, Burundian, and Somali) and host communities on housing, land, and property rights (‘HLP’) (community outreach).

• Counselling refugees on HLP on an individual basis and supporting them with related issues such as investigations and tenancy disputes after conducting legal research in the applicable legislation.

• Raising awareness through home visits about refugee legal framework, and refugee integration in the host community.

• Providing group information sessions to refugees about the process and necessary documentation for applying for refugee status and supporting relevant applications and appeals on an individual basis.

• Participated in organizing refugee surveys about HLP and refugee status determination and analyzed qualitative and quantitative data based on the responses.

• Supporting community partners/stakeholders to advocate for policy changes affecting their community.

• Monitoring court cases and legislative developments about refugees.
